clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Bowel Preparation With an Educational Video
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Bowel Preparation With an Education Video

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators goal is to improve bowel preparations with an educational video on the Center for Digestive Disorders (CDD) website that explains the steps required for bowel preparation for those patients undergoing screening colonoscopies. The video will focus on explaining the purpose of a screening colonoscopy, the rationale for bowel preparation, the pre-colonoscopy diet, and the instructions for completing the laxative. In a randomized fashion, patients in the control group will receive the standard written bowel preparation instructions, while patients in the intervention group will receive standard written instructions plus a link to watch the instructional video. The investigators hypothesize that an educational tool that provides visual examples of a good and poor preparation, examples of the pre-colonoscopy diet, and an explanation of how to administer the laxative will lead to improved patient compliance and a better bowel preparation. In addition, the investigators hypothesize that a better quality bowel preparation will improve detection of colonic polyps and fewer recommendations for repeat colonoscopy based solely on inadequate bowel preparation.

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be the endoscopist's assessment of the quality of preparation using a standardized bowel preparation scale

secondary_outcome.description: time from insertion to cecum and time from cecum to anus
Patient compliance with preparation instructions self-reported in a pre-procedure questionnaire
Presence and severity of preparation associated side effects including: blaoting, abdominal pain, and nausea/vomiting
patient's perception of the helpfulness of the video as self-reported on a pre-procedure questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of repeat colonoscopies due to inadequate bowel preparation
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded endoscopist's assesment about the need for a repeat colonoscopy due to inadequate bowel preparation

arm_group.description: The control arm will receive written instructions on preparing for a colonoscopy per standard of care at Boston Medical Center

The investigational, or experimental arm, will receive standard written instructions on preparing for a colonoscopy plus instructions asking them to watch an educational video on the Center for Digestive Disorders website

intervention.description: Instructions to view an educational video about preparing for a colonoscopy
Written instructions on preparing for a colonoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all outpatients
- age >18
- referred and scheduled for an elective screening colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- inpatients
- prisoners
- patients allergic to PEG-ELS based laxatives
